Jokowi Pastikan Harga Gas Industri Tak Naik, ESDM Diminta Hitung
01 Nov 2019, 09:50 by Bisnis.com, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo memerintahkan kepada Menteri Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) Arifin Tasrif untuk menghitung komponen harga gas bagi kebutuhan industri. Jokowi memastikan bahwa harga gas industri tidak akan dinaikan.
“Saya sampaikan ke Menteri ESDM harga gas agar dilihat lagi beban mana yang membuat angka-angka di (komponen harga) gas kita dibandingkan dengan negara lain lebih mahal,” ujarnya, dalam sesi bincang santai dengan wartawan di Istana Negara, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Jokowi menyatakan Indonesia memiliki sumber produksi gas yang cukup besar. Namun, beberapa di antaranya dijual dan disalurkan ke negara lain seperti Singapura. Oleh sebab itu, Jokowi ingin agar Menteri ESDM juga melakukan negosiasi ulang dengan sejumlah produsen gas.
Untuk industri tertentu, harga gas memang sangat menentukan sekali. Beberapa sentra produksi gas yang masih disuplai untuk negara lain di Singapura, agar bisa dilakukan negosiasi aga bisa dipakai industri dalam negeri,” katanya.
Kepala Negara menyatakan bahwa harga gas sangat memengaruhi industri tertentu. Akibatnya, saat ada kenaikan harga gas, berdampak pada kelangsungan usaha yang membuat daya saing industri juga terpengaruh.
text:
Jokowi Ensures Industrial Gas Prices Will Not Go Up, EMR Requested to be Calculated
01 Nov 2019, 09:50 by Bisnis.com, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - President Joko Widodo ordered the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) Arifin Tasrif to calculate the gas price component for industrial needs. Jokowi ensured that industrial gas prices would not be increased.
"I would like to convey to the Minister of ESDM that the price of gas is to be seen again which burden makes the figures in (gas price components) of our gas compared to other countries more expensive," he said, in a relaxed conversation session with reporters at the State Palace, Friday, November 1, 2019 .
Jokowi said Indonesia has a sizable gas production source. However, some of them are sold and distributed to other countries such as Singapore. Therefore, Jokowi wants the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources to also renegotiate with a number of gas producers.
For certain industries, gas prices are very crucial. "Some of the gas production centers are still being supplied to other countries in Singapore, so that negotiations can be carried out for domestic industry," he said.
The Head of State stated that the price of gas greatly affected certain industries. As a result, when there is an increase in gas prices, it will have an impact on business continuity, which will also affect industry competitiveness.
